review: The Fire Stick is easy to set up.  It is very self evident and you get it right almost immediately.  I only give it 4 stars because the interface requires a bit of work. You have to Google or search in the Amazon site for directions to access apps, games, and other programs.  I found that the Apple TV was much more user friendly but liked the small size for using when I travel.  With practice, it is not difficult to access programming but the search bar/key needs to be fully outlined at the top and not hiding somewhere in the programming lines. Further, setting up a pin code requires you to use the remote to access what you purchased and the directions for that are not immediately easy to understand.Overall, a I like the Fire Stick but you need to play with it to use it without wanting to throw the remote at the tv.
author: Electronics gal "Vicky"

review: If you have Amazon Prime (or even Netflix and others) this is the easiest way to enjoy those services.  I simply plug it in to my receivers' front panel input (and front panel USB power with a short power cable), and go.  I can take it to any of my 4 receivers in the house and do this.  Great for guest rooms as it is easy to select with a receiver input and then easily use by most people.
